<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
US&nbsp;Airways recognized compensation expense related to
US&nbsp;Airways Group Class&nbsp;A Common Stock, stock option
and stock warrant grants to US&nbsp;Airways employees of
$11&nbsp;million, $50&nbsp;million and $135&nbsp;million for the
nine months ended September&nbsp;30, 2005, the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2004 and the nine months ended
December&nbsp;31, 2003, respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Prior to emergence from the first bankruptcy, the Predecessor
Company accounted for deferred compensation and the related
amortization by applying the provisions of APB&nbsp;25 and
related interpretations. In accordance with APB&nbsp;25,
deferred compensation related to grants of US&nbsp;Airways Group
common stock to employees (&#147;Stock Grants&#148;) was
recognized based on the fair market value of the stock on the
date of grant. Except on limited occasions, no deferred
compensation was recognized when options to purchase
US&nbsp;Airways Group common stock were granted to employees
(&#147;Option Grants&#148;) because the exercise price of the
stock options was set equal to the fair market value of the
underlying stock on the date of grant. Any deferred compensation
was amortized as Personnel costs over the applicable vesting
period.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
US&nbsp;Airways recognized expenses related to Stock Grants of
$1&nbsp;million for the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2003.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
There were no stock options awarded in the three months ended
March&nbsp;31, 2003 or the nine months ended December&nbsp;31,
2003.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Compensation expense of $1&nbsp;million, calculated using the
provisions of APB&nbsp;25, has been recorded for stock
appreciation rights and restricted stock units granted to
US&nbsp;Airways employees in the fourth quarter of 2005.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">

<TR>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD><B>15.</B></TD>
    <TD>
    <B>2003 Fresh-start reporting</B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
In connection with its emergence from the first bankruptcy on
March&nbsp;31, 2003, US&nbsp;Airways adopted fresh-start
reporting in accordance with
SOP&nbsp;<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">90-7.</FONT>
Accordingly, US&nbsp;Airways valued its assets, liabilities and
equity at fair value. The excess of the reorganization value
over tangible assets and identifiable intangible assets was
reflected as goodwill on the balance sheet. Estimates of fair
value represented the best estimate based on independent
appraisals and valuations and, where the foregoing were not
available, industry trends and by reference to market rates and
transactions. US&nbsp;Airways Group&#146;s equity value of
$438&nbsp;million at March&nbsp;31, 2003 was determined with the
assistance of financial advisors. In determining the equity
value, the financial advisors and US&nbsp;Airways Group
considered several matters, including the following:
(i)&nbsp;certain recent financial information of US&nbsp;Airways
Group; (ii)&nbsp;certain financial projections prepared by
US&nbsp;Airways Group in connection with the ATSB Loan and the
investment agreement with
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">264

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">
<B>US&nbsp;Airways, Inc.</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">
<B>Notes to the Financial
Statements&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;(Continued)</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">
RSA including the underlying assumptions; (iii)&nbsp;the equity
transactions encompassed by the investment agreement with RSA;
(iv)&nbsp;a discounted cash flow analysis prepared on a going
concern basis; (v)&nbsp;current and historical market values of
publicly traded companies that are in businesses reasonably
comparable to US&nbsp;Airways Group and (vi)&nbsp;certain
additional economic and industry conditions.
US&nbsp;Airways&#146; equity value of $349&nbsp;million was
determined based on a review of each of US&nbsp;Airways
Group&#146;s subsidiaries&#146; fair value of assets and
liabilities. US&nbsp;Airways received third party appraisals for
certain assets and liabilities subsequent to March&nbsp;31,
2003. Changes in the fair value of these assets and liabilities
from the previously estimated values impacted the reported value
of goodwill.
</DIV>

</CENTER>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 3pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">
<DIV style="width: 18%; border-top: 1.0pt solid black; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" align="center" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    (a)</TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    See Notes&nbsp;3(c) and 4.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 3pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    (b)</TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    Allowance for obsolescence of inventories eliminated upon
    adoption of fresh-start reporting. See Notes&nbsp;3(b) and 15.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 3pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    (c)</TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="top">
    In connection with purchase accounting, US&nbsp;Airways accrued
    severance and benefits related to planned reductions in force
    for its non union employees. See Note&nbsp;3(b).</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">266

the emergence from bankruptcy and merger with America West

additional information related to the fresh-start reporting and
unusual items. The sum of the four quarters may not equal the
totals for the year due to rounding.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">

<TR>
    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD width="95%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD><B>19.</B></TD>
    <TD>
    <B>Subsequent event</B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">

<TR>
    <TD width="6%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD></TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I>Purchase of 757 aircraft</I></B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
On February&nbsp;23, 2006, US&nbsp;Airways executed an agreement
to purchase three Boeing
<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">757-200</FONT> aircraft for
delivery on February&nbsp;24, 2006. US&nbsp;Airways purchased
the aircraft for cash and anticipates arranging financing for
all three aircraft through asset-based financing or sale
leasebacks at a later date. US&nbsp;Airways Group plans to
utilize these aircraft primarily in the US&nbsp;Airways fleet.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">267

<A name='116'></A>
</DIV>

<!-- link1 "Item 9. Changes in and Disagreements with Accountants on Accounting and Financial Disclosure" -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">

    <TD width="8%"></TD>
    <TD width="92%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD><B>Item&nbsp;9.</B></TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I>Changes in and Disagreements with Accountants on
    Accounting and Financial Disclosure</I></B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
None.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">
<A name='117'></A>
</DIV>

<!-- link1 "Item 9A. Controls and Procedures" -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">

<TR>
    <TD width="9%"></TD>
    <TD width="91%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD><B>Item&nbsp;9A.</B></TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I>Controls and Procedures</I></B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Section&nbsp;404 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 requires
management to include in this Annual Report on
Form&nbsp;<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">10-K</FONT> a report
on management&#146;s assessment of the effectiveness of
US&nbsp;Airways Group&#146;s and US&nbsp;Airways&#146; internal
control over financial reporting, as well as an attestation
report from US&nbsp;Airways Group&#146;s and
US&nbsp;Airways&#146; independent registered public accounting
firm on management&#146;s assessment of the effectiveness of
US&nbsp;Airways Group&#146;s and US&nbsp;Airways&#146; internal
control over financial reporting. Management&#146;s annual
report on internal control over financial reporting and the
related attestation report from US&nbsp;Airways Group&#146;s and
US&nbsp;Airways&#146; independent registered public accounting
firm are located in Item&nbsp;8A. &#147;Consolidated Financial
Statements and Supplementary Data of US&nbsp;Airways Group,
Inc.&#148; and Item&nbsp;8C. &#147;Consolidated Financial
Statements and Supplementary Data of US&nbsp;Airways, Inc.&#148;
and are incorporated herein by reference.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">
<B>Disclosure Controls and Procedures</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
An evaluation was performed under the supervision and with the
participation of US&nbsp;Airways Group&#146;s, AWA&#146;s and
US&nbsp;Airways&#146; management, including the Chief Executive
Officer (the &#147;CEO&#148;) and Chief Financial Officer (the
&#147;CFO&#148;), of the effectiveness of the design and
operation of our disclosure controls and procedures (as defined
in the rules promulgated under the Exchange Act) as of
December&nbsp;31, 2005. Based on that evaluation, our
management, including the CEO and CFO, concluded that our
disclosure controls and procedures were effective as of
December&nbsp;31, 2005.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">
<B>Changes in Internal Control over Financial Reporting</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
There has been no change to US&nbsp;Airways Group&#146;s,
AWA&#146;s or US&nbsp;Airways&#146; internal control over
financial reporting that occurred during the quarter ended
December&nbsp;31, 2005 that has materially affected, or is
reasonably likely to materially affect, US&nbsp;Airways
Group&#146;s, AWA&#146;s or US&nbsp;Airways&#146; internal
control over financial reporting other than controls established
to properly account for the merger and consolidation of acquired
operations. US&nbsp;Airways Group will face significant
challenges in integrating procedures and operations in a timely
and efficient manner and retaining key personnel. Management
will continue to evaluate its internal control over financial
reporting as it executes merger integration activities as it is
possible that integration activities could materially affect
US&nbsp;Airways Group&#146;s, AWA&#146;s or
US&nbsp;Airways&#146; internal control over financial reporting.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<B>Limitation on the effectiveness of controls.</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
We believe that a controls system, no matter how well designed
and operated, cannot provide absolute assurance that the
objectives of the controls system are met and no evaluation of
controls can provide absolute assurance that all control issues
and instances of fraud, if any, within a company have been
detected. Our disclosure controls and procedures are designed to
provide reasonable assurance of achieving their objectives, and
the CEO and CFO believe that our disclosure controls and
procedures were effective at the &#147;reasonable
assurance&#148; level as of December&nbsp;31, 2005.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">
<A name='118'></A>
</DIV>

<TR>
    <TD width="9%"></TD>
    <TD width="91%"></TD>
</TR>

    <TD><B>Item&nbsp;9B.</B></TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I>Other Information</I></B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
None.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">
<A name='119'></A>
</DIV>

<!-- link1 "PART III" -->

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 18pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">
<B>PART&nbsp;III</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
The information required by Part&nbsp;III of this
Form&nbsp;<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">10-K,</FONT>
pursuant to General Instruction&nbsp;G(3) of
Form&nbsp;<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">10-K,</FONT> will be
set forth in US&nbsp;Airways Group&#146;s definitive Proxy
Statement to be filed pursuant to Regulation&nbsp;14A relating
to US&nbsp;Airways Group&#146;s Annual Meeting of Stockholders
on May&nbsp;17, 2006 and is incorporated herein by reference.
US&nbsp;Airways Group will, within 120&nbsp;days of the end of
its fiscal year, file with the SEC a definitive proxy statement
pursuant to Regulation&nbsp;14A.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">
<A name='120'></A>
</DIV>

<!-- link1 "Item 10. Directors and Executive Officers of the Registrants" -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; color: #000000; background: #ffffff;"></DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">

<TR>
    <TD width="9%"></TD>
    <TD width="91%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD><B>Item&nbsp;10.</B></TD>
    <TD>
    <B><I>Directors and Executive Officers of the Registrants</I></B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Information regarding US&nbsp;Airways Group&#146;s, AWA&#146;s
and US&nbsp;Airways&#146; directors and executive officers
required by this Item will be set forth under the caption
&#147;Proposal&nbsp;1&nbsp;&#151; Election of Directors,&#148;
&#147;Executive Officers&#148; and &#147;Section&nbsp;16(a)
Beneficial Ownership Reporting Compliance&#148; in
US&nbsp;Airways Group&#146;s definitive Proxy Statement and is
incorporated by reference into this Annual Report on
Form&nbsp;<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">10-K.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
The Company has adopted a Code of Business Conduct and Ethics
(&#147;Code&#148;) within the meaning of Item&nbsp;406(b) of
Regulation&nbsp;<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">S-K.</FONT>
The Code applies to the officers, directors and employees of
US&nbsp;Airways Group and its subsidiaries. The Code,
US&nbsp;Airways Group&#146;s Corporate Governance Guidelines and
the charters of the Company&#146;s Board committees are publicly
available on US&nbsp;Airways Group&#146;s website at
<I>www.usairways.com.</I> Printed copies of the Code, the
Corporate Governance Guidelines and the charters of the Board
committees are available at no charge to any stockholder upon
request to the Company&#146;s Corporate Secretary at America
West Holdings Corporation, 111&nbsp;West Rio Salado Parkway,
Tempe, Arizona 85281. If US&nbsp;Airways Group makes substantive
amendments to the Code or grants any waiver, including any
implicit waiver, to its principal executive officer, principal
financial officer, principal accounting officer or controller,
and persons performing similar functions, US&nbsp;Airways Group
will disclose the nature of such amendment or waiver on its
website or in a Current Report on
Form&nbsp;<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">8-K</FONT> in
accordance with applicable rules and regulations. The
information contained on or connected to US&nbsp;Airways
Group&#146;s website is not incorporated by reference into this
Form&nbsp;<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">10-K</FONT> and
should not be considered part of this or any other report that
US&nbsp;Airways Group files or furnishes with the SEC.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
US&nbsp;Airways Group&#146;s stock is listed on the NYSE. As a
result, its Chief Executive Officer is required to make and will
make a CEO&#146;s Annual Certification to the New York Stock
Exchange in accordance with Section&nbsp;303A.12 of the New York
Stock Exchange Listed Company Manual stating that he was not
aware of any violations by US&nbsp;Airways Group of the NYSE
corporate governance listing standards.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff;">
<A name='121'></A>

of the Company&#146;s long-term debt agreements does not exceed

paragraph&nbsp;(b)(4)(iii) of Item&nbsp;601 of

furnish to the Commission upon request a copy of any agreement
with respect to such long-term debt.

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt;color: #000000; background: #ffffff; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0; ">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS, that each individual whose
signature appears below constitutes and appoints W. Douglas
Parker and Derek J. Kerr and each or any of them, his or her
true and lawful attorneys and agents, with full power of
substitution and resubstitution, for him or her and in his or
her name, place and stead, in any and all capacities, to sign
any and all amendments to the Registrants&#146; Annual Report on
Form&nbsp;<FONT style="white-space: nowrap">10-K</FONT> for the
fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2005, and to file the same
with all exhibits thereto, and all other documents in connection
therewith, with the Securities and Exchange Commission, granting
unto said attorneys and agents, and each or any of them, full
power and authority to do and perform each and every act and
thing requisite and necessary to be done, as fully to all
intents and purposes as he or she might or could do in person,
hereby ratifying and confirming all that said attorneys and
agents, and each of them, or his substitute or substitutes, may
lawfully do or cause to be done by virtue hereof.
</DIV>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.74
<SEQUENCE>2
<FILENAME>p72019exv10w74.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-10.74
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10w74</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10.74</B></FONT>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>US Airways Group, Inc.</B></FONT><BR>
<FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>2005 Equity Incentive Plan</B></FONT><BR>
<FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Stock Unit Award Agreement</B></FONT>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant to the Stock Unit Award Grant Notice (&#147;<B><I>Grant Notice</I></B>&#148;) and this Stock Unit Award
Agreement (&#147;<B><I>Award Agreement</I></B>&#148;), US Airways Group, Inc. (the &#147;<B><I>Company</I></B>&#148;) has awarded you a Stock Unit
Award under its 2005 Equity Incentive Plan (the &#147;<B><I>Plan</I></B>&#148;) for the number of stock units (&#147;<B><I>Stock
Units</I></B>&#148;) as indicated in the Grant Notice (collectively, the &#147;<B><I>Award</I></B>&#148;). Except where indicated
otherwise, defined terms not explicitly defined in this Award Agreement but defined in the Plan
shall have the same definitions as in the Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The details of your Award are as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>1.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Number of Stock Units and Shares of Common Stock.</B></FONT> The number of Stock Units
subject to your Award is set forth in the Grant Notice. Each Stock Unit shall represent the right
to receive one (1)&nbsp;share of Common Stock. The number of Stock Units subject to your Award and the
number of shares of Common Stock deliverable with respect to such Stock Units may be adjusted from
time to time for capitalization adjustments as described in Section 12(a) of the Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>2.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Vesting</B></FONT>. The Stock Units shall vest, if at all, as provided in the vesting
schedule set forth in your Grant Notice, <I>provided, however</I>, that:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(a) </B>vesting shall cease upon the termination of your Continuous Service; and
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(b) </B>vesting of all Stock Units shall be fully accelerated in the event that (i)&nbsp;your
Continuous Service is terminated by the Company without Cause (as defined in the Plan) or by reason
of your death or Disability (as defined in the Plan), (ii)&nbsp;you terminate your Continuous Service
for Good Reason (as defined in your Executive Change in Control and Severance Benefits Agreement or
Employment Agreement, as applicable) or (iii)&nbsp;your Continuous Service is terminated involuntarily
with or without Cause (as defined in the Plan) within twenty-four (24)&nbsp;months following a Change in
Control (as defined in the Plan) of the Company that occurs subsequent to September&nbsp;27, 2005.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>3.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Dividends</B></FONT><B>. </B>You will be entitled to receive payments equal to any cash dividends
and other distributions paid with respect to a corresponding number of shares subject to your
Award, provided that if any such dividends or distributions are paid in shares, the Fair Market
Value of such shares will be converted into additional shares covered by the Award, and further
provided that such additional shares will be subject to the same forfeiture restrictions,
restrictions on transferability, and time and manner of delivery as apply to the other Stock Units
and Common Stock subject to your Award.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>4.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Payment</B></FONT>. This Award was granted in consideration of your services to the Company.
Subject to Section&nbsp;10 below, you will not be required to make any payment to the Company (other
than your past and future services with the Company) with respect to your
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">receipt of the Award, vesting of the Stock Units, or the delivery of the shares of Common
Stock subject to the Stock Units, other than any required withholding.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>5.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Delivery of Shares.</B></FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(a) </B>Subject to Sections 5(b) and 10 below, your vested Units shall be converted into shares of
Common Stock, and the Company will deliver to you a number of shares of the Company&#146;s Common Stock
equal to the number of vested shares subject to your Award, on the applicable vesting date. The
form of delivery (<I>e.g.</I>, a stock certificate or electronic entry evidencing such shares) shall be
determined by the Company.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(b) </B>In the event that the Company determines that you are subject to its policy regarding
trading of the Company&#146;s stock by its officers and directors and any shares of Common Stock subject
to your Award are scheduled to be delivered on a day (the &#147;<B><I>Original Distribution Date</I></B>&#148;) that does
not occur during a &#147;window period&#148; applicable to you, as determined by the Company in accordance
with such policy, then such shares shall not be delivered on such Original Distribution Date and
shall instead be delivered on the first day of the next &#147;window period&#148; applicable to you pursuant
to such policy.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>6.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Securities Law Compliance</B></FONT>. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained
herein, you will not be issued any shares of Common Stock under your Award unless either (a)&nbsp;such
shares are then registered under the Securities Act or (b)&nbsp;the Company has determined that such
issuance would be exempt from the registration requirements of the Securities Act. Your Award also
must comply with other applicable laws and regulations governing the Award, and you will not
receive any shares of Common Stock under your Award if the Company determines that such receipt
would not be in material compliance with such laws and regulations.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>7.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Transfer Restrictions.</B></FONT> Prior to the time that the shares of Common Stock subject
to your Award have been delivered to you, you may not transfer, pledge, sell or otherwise dispose
of such shares. For example, you may not use shares of Common Stock that may be issued in respect
of your Stock Units as security for a loan, nor may you transfer, pledge, sell or otherwise dispose
of such shares. This restriction on transfer will lapse upon delivery to you of shares of Common
Stock in respect of your vested Stock Units. Your Award is not transferable, except by will or by
the laws of descent and distribution.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>8.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Award not a Service Contract</B></FONT>. Your Award is not an employment or service
contract, and nothing in your Award shall be deemed to create in any way whatsoever any obligation
on your part to continue in the service of the Company or any Affiliate, or on the part of the
Company or any Affiliate to continue such service. In addition, nothing in your Award shall
obligate the Company or any Affiliate, their respective stockholders, boards of directors or
employees to continue any relationship that you might have as an Employee or Consultant of the
Company or any Affiliate.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>9.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Unsecured Obligation. </B></FONT>Your Award is unfunded, and even as a holder of vested
Stock Units, you shall be considered an unsecured creditor of the Company with respect
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">to the Company&#146;s obligation, if any, to distribute shares of Common Stock pursuant to this
Agreement. You shall not have voting or any other rights as a stockholder of the Company with
respect to the Common Stock acquired pursuant to this Agreement until such Common Stock is issued
to you. Nothing contained in this Agreement, and no action taken pursuant to its provisions, shall
create or be construed to create a trust of any kind or a fiduciary relationship between you and
the Company or any other person.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>10.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Withholding Obligations.</B></FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(a) </B>At the time you receive a distribution of shares of Common Stock pursuant to your Award,
or at any time thereafter as requested by the Company, you hereby authorize withholding from
payroll and any other amounts payable to you, in the same calendar year as you exercise your Award,
and otherwise agree to make adequate provision for any sums required to satisfy the federal, state,
local and foreign tax withholding obligations of the Company or an Affiliate, if any, which arise
in connection with such distribution.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(b) </B>Upon your request and subject to approval by the Company, in its sole discretion, and
compliance with any applicable legal conditions or restrictions, the Company may withhold from
fully vested shares of Common Stock otherwise issuable to you pursuant to your Award a number of
whole shares of Common Stock having a Fair Market Value, determined by the Company as of the date
of distribution, not in excess of the minimum amount of tax required to be withheld by law (or such
lesser amount as may be necessary to avoid variable award accounting).
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(c) </B>Unless the tax withholding obligations of the Company and/or any Affiliate thereof are
satisfied, the Company shall have no obligation to deliver to you any shares of Common Stock
pursuant to your Award.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>11.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Notices</B></FONT>. Any notices provided for in your Award or the Plan shall be given in
writing and shall be deemed effectively given upon receipt or, in the case of notices delivered by
the Company to you, five (5)&nbsp;days after deposit in the United States mail, postage prepaid,
addressed to you at the last address you provided to the Company.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>12.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Miscellaneous</B>.</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(a) </B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"> </FONT>The rights and obligations of the Company with respect to your Award shall be
transferable to any one or more persons or entities, and all covenants and agreements hereunder
shall inure to the benefit of, and be enforceable by the Company&#146;s successors and assigns.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(b) </B>You agree upon request to execute any further documents or instruments necessary or
desirable in the sole determination of the Company to carry out the purposes or intent of your
Award.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(c) </B>You acknowledge and agree that you have reviewed your Award in its entirety, have had an
opportunity to obtain the advice of counsel prior to executing and accepting your Award and fully
understand all provisions of your Award.
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(d) </B>This Agreement will be subject to all applicable laws, rules, and regulations, and to such
approvals by any governmental agencies or national securities exchanges as may be required.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(e) </B>All obligations of the Company under the Plan and this Agreement will be binding on any
successor to the Company, whether the existence of such successor is the result of a direct or
indirect purchase, merger, consolidation, or otherwise, of all or substantially all of the business
and/or assets of the Company.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>13.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Headings</B></FONT><B>. </B>The headings of the Sections in this Agreement are inserted for
convenience only and shall not be deemed to constitute a part of this Agreement or to affect the
meaning of this Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>14.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Severability</B>.</FONT> If all or any part of this Agreement or the Plan is declared by
any court or governmental authority to be unlawful or invalid, such unlawfulness or invalidity
shall not invalidate any portion of this Agreement or the Plan not declared to be unlawful or
invalid. Any Section of this Agreement (or part of such a Section) so declared to be unlawful or
invalid shall, if possible, be construed in a manner which will give effect to the terms of such
Section or part of a Section to the fullest extent possible while remaining lawful and valid.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>15.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Governing Plan Document</B></FONT>. Your Award is subject to all the provisions of the
Plan, the provisions of which are hereby made a part of your Award, and is further subject to all
interpretations, amendments, rules and regulations which may from time to time be promulgated and
adopted pursuant to the Plan. In the event of any conflict between the provisions of your Award
and those of the Plan, the provisions of the Plan shall control.
</DIV>

<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">* * * * *

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Stock Unit Award Agreement shall be deemed to be signed by the Company and the
Participant upon the signing by the Participant of the Stock Unit Grant Notice to which it is
attached.
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10w75</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10.75</B></FONT>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>US Airways Group, Inc.</B></FONT><BR>
<FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>2005 Equity Incentive Plan</B></FONT><BR>
<FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Stock Appreciation Right Award Agreement</B></FONT>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant to the Stock Appreciation Right Award Grant Notice (&#147;<B><I>Grant Notice</I></B>&#148;) and this Stock
Appreciation Right Award Agreement (&#147;<B><I>Award Agreement</I></B>&#148;), US Airways Group, Inc. (the &#147;<B><I>Company</I></B>&#148;) has
awarded you a Stock Appreciation Right Award under its 2005 Equity Incentive Plan (the &#147;<B><I>Plan</I></B>&#148;) for
the number of stock appreciation rights (&#147;<B><I>Stock Appreciation Rights</I></B>&#148;) as indicated in the Grant
Notice (collectively, the &#147;<B><I>Award</I></B>&#148;). Except where indicated otherwise, defined terms not explicitly
defined in this Award Agreement but defined in the Plan shall have the same definitions as in the
Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The details of your Award are as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>1.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Number of Stock Appreciation Rights. </B></FONT>The number of Stock Appreciation Rights
subject to your Award is set forth in the Grant Notice. Such number may be adjusted from time to
time for capitalization adjustments as described in Section 12(a) of the Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>2.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Calculation of Appreciation.</B></FONT> The amount payable upon exercise of each vested
Stock Appreciation Right shall be equal to the excess of (A)&nbsp;the Fair Market Value per share of
Common Stock on the date of exercise, over (B)&nbsp;the Fair Market Value per share of Common Stock on
the date of grant of the Stock Appreciation Right (as indicated in the Grant Notice).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>3.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Vesting</B></FONT>. The Stock Appreciation Rights shall vest, if at all, as provided in the
vesting schedule set forth in your Grant Notice, <I>provided, however</I>, that:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(a) </B>vesting shall cease upon the termination of your Continuous Service; and
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(b) </B>vesting of all Stock Appreciation Rights shall be fully accelerated in the event that (i)
your Continuous Service is terminated by the Company without Cause (as defined in the Plan) or by
reason of your death or Disability (as defined in the Plan), (ii)&nbsp;you terminate your Continuous
Service for Good Reason (as defined in your Executive Change in Control and Severance Benefits
Agreement) or Employment Agreement as applicable; or (iii)&nbsp;your Continuous Service is terminated
involuntarily with or without Cause (as defined in the Plan) within twenty-four (24)&nbsp;months
following a Change in Control (as defined in the Plan) of the Company that occurs subsequent to
September&nbsp;27, 2005.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>4.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Exercise.</B></FONT> You may exercise the vested portion of your Award during its term by
delivering a Notice of Exercise (in a form designated by the Company) to the Secretary of the
Company, or to such other person as the Company may designate, during regular business hours,
together with such additional documents as the Company may then require. The exercise date will be
the business day on which your signed Notice of Exercise is received by the Company. If
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">the Notice of Exercise is received after normal business hours for a given day, then the
exercise date will be considered to be the following business day.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>5.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Term.</B></FONT> You may not exercise your Award before the commencement or after the
expiration of its term. The term of your Award commences on the Date of Grant and expires upon the
earliest of the following:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(a) </B>immediately upon the termination of your Continuous Service for Cause (as defined in the
Plan);
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(b) </B>three (3)&nbsp;months after the termination of your Continuous Service for any reason (other
than for Cause or your death, Disability or Retirement), provided that if during any part of such
three (3)&nbsp;month period you may not exercise your Award solely because of the condition set forth in
Section&nbsp;7 relating to &#147;Securities Law Compliance,&#148; your Award shall not expire until the earlier of
the Expiration Date or until it shall have been exercisable for an aggregate period of three (3)
months after the termination of your Continuous Service;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(c) </B>three (3)&nbsp;years after your death if you die either during your Continuous Service or
within three (3)&nbsp;months after your Continuous Service terminates for any reason other than Cause;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(d) </B>three (3)&nbsp;years after the termination of your Continuous Service due to your Disability;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(e) </B>three (3)&nbsp;years after the termination of your Continuous Service due to your Retirement;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(f) </B>the Expiration Date indicated in your Grant Notice; or
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(g) </B>the day before the tenth (10<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP>) anniversary of the Date of Grant.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>6.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Payment. </B></FONT>Subject to Section&nbsp;10, the amount payable upon exercise of the Award
shall be settled in shares of Common Stock based on the Fair Market Value of such shares at the
time of exercise.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>7.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Securities Law Compliance</B></FONT>. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained
herein, you may not exercise your Award unless either (a)&nbsp;the shares of Common Stock issuable upon
such exercise are then registered under the Securities Act or (b)&nbsp;the Company has determined that
such exercise and issuance would be exempt from the registration requirements of the Securities
Act. The exercise of your Award also must comply with other applicable laws and regulations
governing the Award, and you may not exercise your Award if the Company determines that such
exercise would not be in material compliance with such laws and regulations.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>8.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Transfer Restrictions.</B></FONT> Your Award is not transferable, except by will or by the
laws of descent and distribution, and is exercisable during your life only by you.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>9.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Award not a Service Contract</B></FONT>. Your Award is not an employment or service
contract, and nothing in your Award shall be deemed to create in any way whatsoever any obligation
on your part to continue in the service of the Company or any Affiliate, or on the part of the
Company or any Affiliate to continue such service. In addition, nothing in your Award shall
obligate the Company or any Affiliate, their respective stockholders, boards of directors or
employees to continue any relationship that you might have as an Employee or Consultant of the
Company or any Affiliate.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>10.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Withholding Obligations.</B></FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(a) </B>At the time you exercise your Award, in whole or in part, or at any time thereafter as
requested by the Company, you hereby authorize withholding from payroll and any other amounts
payable to you, and otherwise agree to make adequate provision for any sums required to satisfy the
federal, state, local and foreign tax withholding obligations of the Company or an Affiliate, if
any, which arise in connection with the exercise of your Award, in the same calendar year as you
exercise your Award.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(b) </B>Upon your request and subject to approval by the Company, in its sole discretion, and
compliance with any applicable legal conditions or restrictions, the Company may withhold from
fully vested shares of Common Stock otherwise issuable to you upon the exercise of your Award a
number of whole shares of Common Stock having a Fair Market Value, determined by the Company as of
the date of exercise, not in excess of the minimum amount of tax required to be withheld by law (or
such lower amount as may be necessary to avoid variable award accounting).
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(c) </B>You may not exercise your Award unless the tax withholding obligations of the Company
and/or any Affiliate are satisfied. Accordingly, you may not be able to exercise your Award when
desired even though your Award is vested, and the Company shall have no obligation to issue a
certificate for such shares of Common Stock unless such obligations are satisfied.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>11.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Notices</B></FONT>. Any notices provided for in your Award or the Plan shall be given in
writing and shall be deemed effectively given upon receipt or, in the case of notices delivered by
the Company to you, five (5)&nbsp;days after deposit in the United States mail, postage prepaid,
addressed to you at the last address you provided to the Company.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>12.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Miscellaneous</B>.</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(a) </B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"> </FONT>The rights and obligations of the Company with respect to your Award shall be
transferable to any one or more persons or entities, and all covenants and agreements hereunder
shall inure to the benefit of, and be enforceable by the Company&#146;s successors and assigns.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(b) </B>You agree upon request to execute any further documents or instruments necessary or
desirable in the sole determination of the Company to carry out the purposes or intent of your
Award.
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(c) </B>You acknowledge and agree that you have reviewed your Award in its entirety, have had an
opportunity to obtain the advice of counsel prior to executing and accepting your Award and fully
understand all provisions of your Award.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(d) </B>This Agreement will be subject to all applicable laws, rules, and regulations, and to such
approvals by any governmental agencies or national securities exchanges as may be required.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>(e) </B>All obligations of the Company under the Plan and this Agreement will be binding on any
successor to the Company, whether the existence of such successor is the result of a direct or
indirect purchase, merger, consolidation, or otherwise, of all or substantially all of the business
and/or assets of the Company.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>13.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Headings</B></FONT><B>. </B>The headings of the Sections in this Agreement are inserted for
convenience only and shall not be deemed to constitute a part of this Agreement or to affect the
meaning of this Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>14.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Severability</B>.</FONT> If all or any part of this Agreement or the Plan is declared by
any court or governmental authority to be unlawful or invalid, such unlawfulness or invalidity
shall not invalidate any portion of this Agreement or the Plan not declared to be unlawful or
invalid. Any Section of this Agreement (or part of such a Section) so declared to be unlawful or
invalid shall, if possible, be construed in a manner which will give effect to the terms of such
Section or part of a Section to the fullest extent possible while remaining lawful and valid.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>15.&nbsp;</B><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Governing Plan Document</B></FONT>. Your Award is subject to all the provisions of the
Plan, the provisions of which are hereby made a part of your Award, and is further subject to all
interpretations, amendments, rules and regulations which may from time to time be promulgated and
adopted pursuant to the Plan. In the event of any conflict between the provisions of your Award
and those of the Plan, the provisions of the Plan shall control.
</DIV>

<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">* * * * *

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Stock Appreciation Right Award Agreement shall be deemed to be signed by the Company and
the Participant upon the signing by the Participant of the Stock Appreciation Right Award Grant
Notice to which it is attached.
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<TITLE>exv10w79</TITLE>

<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10.79</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><IMG src="p72019p7201900.gif" alt="(U.S AIRWAYS LOGO)"><BR>
<BR><B>U S AIRWAYS GROUP, INC.<BR>
Performance-Based Award Plan<BR>
(Amended and Restated Effective November&nbsp;2, 2005)</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Section&nbsp;I. Purpose</B></FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The purpose of the US Airways Group, Inc. Performance-Based Award Plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;) is to
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><I>Focus management efforts on the creation of long-term stockholder value.</I></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><I>Encourage strategic decision-making by providing rewards for the long-term
achievement of Company goals.</I></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The Plan, formerly known as the America West Airlines Performance-Based Plan, first became
effective as of January&nbsp;1, 2003 (the &#147;Effective Date&#148;). This amended and restated version of the
Plan is effective November&nbsp;2, 2005, and reflects the September&nbsp;27, 2005 merger of America West
Holdings Corporation and US Airways Group, Inc. The Plan is administered in accordance with the U
S Airways Group, Inc. 2005 Equity Incentive Plan
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Section&nbsp;II. Eligibility Criteria</B></FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Officers of US Airways Group, Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;) or an Affiliate (as that term is defined in the
US Airways Group, Inc. 2005 Equity Incentive Plan) whose responsibilities have a direct and
significant impact on Company results are eligible to participate in the Plan. The Compensation
and Human Resources Committee of the Board of Directors of the Company (the &#147;Committee&#148;) will, at
its sole discretion, select individual officers to participate in the Plan (each a &#147;Participant&#148;).
Participation in one performance cycle (as such term is defined in Section&nbsp;IV) under the Plan does
not assure participation in any other performance cycle.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">A person who is hired by the Company (or an Affiliate) as an eligible officer or promoted to
eligible officer status, in either case after the commencement of a performance cycle (as such term
is defined in Section&nbsp;IV) or a transition performance cycle (as such term is defined in Section&nbsp;IV)
(i)&nbsp;shall participate in the Plan only with respect to performance cycles, if any, that commence on
or after the date of hire or promotion, and (ii)&nbsp;shall participate in transition performance cycles
on such basis, if any, as the Committee may provide.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Section&nbsp;III. Award Levels</B></FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Participants have the opportunity to earn cash awards under the Plan based on the achievement of
long-term Company performance and, with certain exceptions set forth in Section&nbsp;V,
</DIV>
<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt">Page 1
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">continued active employment by the Company (or an Affiliate) in an eligible position through the
date of payment of the cash awards. Threshold, target, and maximum award levels are set forth
below. All award levels are expressed as a percentage of a Participant&#146;s base salary, as in effect
on the date of payment of the cash award.
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Award Levels Expressed as </B></FONT><BR>
<FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Percentages of Base Salary</B></FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">
<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD width="20%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="20%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="20%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="20%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD nowrap align="center" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000"><B>Officer Level</B></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="center" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000"><B>Threshold</B></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="center" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000"><B>Target</B></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="center" style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000"><B>Maximum</B></TD>
</TR>

<!-- End Table Head -->
<!-- Begin Table Body -->
<TR valign="bottom" style="background: #cceeff">
    <TD align="center"><DIV style="margin-left:15px; text-indent:-15px">CEO</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">54%</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">125%</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">200%</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD align="center"><DIV style="margin-left:15px; text-indent:-15px">EVP</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">43%</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">100%</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">175%</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="background: #cceeff">
    <TD align="center"><DIV style="margin-left:15px; text-indent:-15px">SVP</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">30%</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">70%</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">140%</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD align="center"><DIV style="margin-left:15px; text-indent:-15px">VP</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">20%</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">45%</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">90%</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Performance below the threshold level for any performance cycle (as such term is defined in
Section&nbsp;IV) or transition performance cycle (as such term is defined in Section&nbsp;IV) will result in
no cash award. The maximum award for any performance cycle is two times the target award, and the
maximum award for any transition performance cycle is the target award, subject in both cases to
further limitations contained in the US Airways Group, Inc. 2005 Equity Incentive Plan.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Section&nbsp;IV. Award Calculation</B></FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Awards are calculated based on Total Stockholder Return (&#147;TSR&#148;) of the Company over the performance
cycle (as such term is defined in this section) or transition performance cycle (as such term is
defined in this section) relative to the TSRs of a pre-defined competitive peer group. TSR, for
purposes of this Plan, is the rate of return, including both the price appreciation of the
Company&#146;s Class&nbsp;A Common Stock or a competitive peer company&#146;s common stock and the reinvestment of
any dividends declared on such common stock, over the relevant performance cycle or transition
performance cycle. In order to smooth out market fluctuations, the average daily closing price
(adjusted for splits and dividends) for the common stock of the Company and of the companies in the
pre-defined competitive peer group for the three months prior to the first and last days of the
performance cycle or transition performance cycle will be used to determine TSR. Daily closing
price of a share of common stock is the stock price at the close of trading (4:00 p.m. Eastern
Time) of the national exchange (New York Stock Exchange, the Nasdaq Stock Market or the American
Stock Exchange) on which such stock is traded.
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>A)</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U><B>Performance Cycles and Transition Performance Cycles</B></U></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>A performance cycle, over which TSR is measured, is the three-year period beginning January
1 of a given year and ending December&nbsp;31 of the second following year (each a &#147;Performance
Cycle&#148;). The Committee, in its sole discretion, may authorize Performance Cycles, and it is
anticipated, although not assured, that a three-year Performance Cycle will begin each
January 1.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>All officers of the Company (or an Affiliate) otherwise eligible to participate in the Plan
will be eligible to participate in a special Performance Cycle commencing September&nbsp;27,
2005, and ending December&nbsp;31, 2008.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt">Page 2
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In addition to the Performance Cycles described in the preceding paragraphs, there will be
two transition performance cycles over which TSR is measured (each a &#147;Transition Performance
Cycle&#148;). Those officers who were not entitled to participate in Performance Cycles
beginning before September&nbsp;27, 2005, will be eligible to participate in two Transition
Performance Cycles beginning on September&nbsp;27, 2005, and ending on December&nbsp;31, 2006, and
December&nbsp;31, 2007, respectively.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>B)</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U><B>Peer Group and Award Payout Percentages</B></U></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The competitive peer group consists of the following thirteen companies: AirTran, Alaska,
American, ATA Holdings, Continental, Delta, Frontier, Hawaiian, JetBlue, Midwest Express,
Northwest, Southwest, and United. Such competitive peer group is subject to modification,
in the Committee&#146;s sole discretion, to take account of unforeseen events such as mergers,
dispositions, bankruptcies and other significant business changes.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Award payout percentages will be based on the TSR of the Company relative to the TSRs of
competitive peer group companies, as follows:</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

</TABLE>
</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">Notwithstanding the ranking of the Company&#146;s TSR, award payout percentages for each of
the Transition Performance Cycles will not exceed the target payouts set forth in the above
table.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Section&nbsp;V. Award Payment Timing, Early Payment and Termination</B></FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">If the TSR of the Company is at or above the threshold for a Performance Cycle or a Transition
Performance Cycle, awards will be paid in cash within sixty (60)&nbsp;days following the end of the
Performance Cycle or Transition Performance Cycle. For example, awards for the Transition
Performance Cycle that runs from September&nbsp;27, 2005, through December&nbsp;31, 2008 will be paid no
later than March&nbsp;1, 2009. Payments will be subject to all required federal, state, and local tax
withholding.
</DIV>


<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt">Page 3
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In the event of the termination of a Participant&#146;s employment with the Company (or an Affiliate) on
account of retirement (as defined below), total disability (as defined in the long term disability
plan under which the Participant is covered) or death, (i)&nbsp;the Company shall pay to the Participant
(or the Participant&#146;s estate in the case of death), at the same time as awards, if any, are paid to
other Participants for the same Performance Cycle, the award that the Participant would have earned
and received with respect to the Performance Cycle, if any, that ends with the calendar year in
which such termination occurs, had the Participant&#146;s employment continued until the award payment
date for such Performance Cycle; and (ii)&nbsp;with respect to a Transition Performance Cycle, the
Company shall pay to the Participant (or the Participant&#146;s estate in the case of death), on the
award payment date, if any, next following the Participant&#146;s termination of employment, the cash
award, if any, that the Participant would have earned and received for that Transition Performance
Cycle had the Participant&#146;s employment continued until the award payment date, but such award shall
be prorated to reflect the period of employment from the commencement of the Participant&#146;s
participation in the Plan with respect to that Transition Performance Cycle to the date of
employment termination. For purposes of the foregoing, &#147;retirement&#148; shall mean the termination of
the Participant&#146;s employment with the Company (or an Affiliate) after attainment of age fifty-five
(55)&nbsp;and completion of ten (10)&nbsp;years of service with the Company (or an Affiliate). Awards for
any other Performance Cycles or Transition Performance Cycle will not be earned or paid.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">If the Participant&#146;s employment with the Company (or an Affiliate) is terminated for any reason
other than retirement, total disability or death (whether such termination is voluntary or
involuntary), no awards will be earned or paid under the Plan with respect to any Performance
Cycles or Transition Performance Cycles.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Section&nbsp;VI. Plan Administration</B></FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The Plan will be administered by the Committee in accordance with the U S Airways Group, Inc. 2005
Equity Incentive Plan and in a manner that satisfies the requirements of Section 162(m) of the
Internal Revenue Code for qualified &#147;performance-based&#148; compensation.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Awards generally are calculated and distributed as provided in Sections&nbsp;IV and V; <I>provided,
however, </I>that no award payments will be made unless the Committee certifies in writing (a)&nbsp;the
relative TSR ranking of the Company, (b)&nbsp;that all other material terms of the Plan have been
satisfied and (c)&nbsp;that payments to Participants in stated amounts are appropriate under the Plan.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Section&nbsp;VII. Absence of Plan Funding; No Equity Interest</B></FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Benefits under the Plan shall be paid from the general funds of the Company, and a Participant (or
the Participant&#146;s estate in the event of death) shall be no more than an unsecured general creditor
of the Company with no special or prior right to any assets of the Company.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Nothing contained in the Plan shall be deemed to give any Participant any equity or other interest
in the assets, business or affairs of the Company or any related company. It is not intended that
a Participant&#146;s interest in the Plan shall constitute a security or equity interest within the
meaning of any state or federal securities laws.
</DIV>


<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt">Page 4
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Section&nbsp;VIII. No Transferability</B></FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">A Participant shall not have any right to transfer, sell, alienate, assign, pledge, mortgage,
collateralize or otherwise encumber any of the payments provided by this Plan.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Section&nbsp;IX. No Employment Rights</B></FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">This Plan is not intended to be a contract of employment. Both the Participant and the Company
have the right to end their employment relationship with or without cause or notice.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><FONT style="font-variant: SMALL-CAPS"><B>Section&nbsp;X. Interpretation, Amendment and Termination</B></FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The Committee shall have the power to interpret all provisions of the Plan, which interpretations
shall be final and binding on all persons. The provisions of this document shall supersede all
provisions of any and all such prior documents relating to the Plan and its subject matter.
However, if the provisions of this document conflict with any provision of the U S Airways Group,
Inc. 2005 Equity Incentive Plan, the provisions set forth in the U S Airways Group, Inc. 2005
Equity Incentive Plan shall govern in all cases. The laws of the State of Delaware shall govern
all questions concerning the construction, validity and interpretation of the Plan, without regard
to such state&#146;s conflict of laws rules.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The Committee reserves the right to amend or terminate the Plan at any time, with or without prior
notice; <I>provided, however, </I>that all amendments to the Plan shall preserve the qualification of
awards under the Plan as &#147;performance-based&#148; compensation under Section 162(m) of the Internal
Revenue Code. Notwithstanding the foregoing, (a)&nbsp;except as provided in Section&nbsp;IV with respect to
the calculation of TSR and in the following clause (b), the Committee may not amend the Plan in a
way that would materially impair the rights of a Participant with respect to a Performance Cycle or
Transition Performance Cycle that already has begun at the time of such amendment, unless such
Participant has consented in writing to such amendment; and (b)&nbsp;in the event of any act of God,
war, natural disaster, aircraft grounding, revocation of operating certificate, terrorism, strike,
lockout, labor dispute, work stoppage, fire, epidemic or quarantine restriction, act of government,
critical materials shortage, or any other act beyond the control of the Company, whether similar or
dissimilar (each a &#147;Force Majeure Event&#148;), which Force Majeure Event affects the Company or its
subsidiaries or other affiliates, the Committee, in its sole discretion, may (i)&nbsp;terminate or (ii)
suspend, delay, defer (for such period of time as the Committee may deem necessary), or substitute
any awards due currently or in the future under the Plan, including, but not limited to, any awards
that have accrued to the benefit of Participants but have not yet been paid.
</DIV>



<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt">Page 5
</DIV>

</BODY>
